channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Corporate America is trying to tell us something about the economy, top analyst says: a 3-year recession for ‘much of the private economy’ ended in April
item.description: Morgan Stanley's Mike Wilson was a lonely voice on Wall Street calling a "rolling recession" when others saw a boom. Now he sees a "rolling recovery."

item.title: KPMG’s new CEO joined as an intern 33 years ago. Now he wants to lure Gen Z back with a new office outfitted with moody lounges and a barista bar
item.description: KPMG is shrinking its New York footprint by 40% and betting on design—not mandates—to bring employees back to the office.

item.title: Fire at Retirement Home in Bosnia Kills at Least 11
item.description: The country’s prime minister called the blaze “a disaster of enormous proportions.” The cause was still to be determined.

item.title: Meet Mira Nair, Zohran Mamdani’s 68-year-old mother who hit it big in Hollywood directing critical darlings like ‘Monsoon Wedding’
item.description: Nair is the first woman director to win the Venice Film Festival's top prize, and famously turned down WB's offer to direct the fourth Harry Potter mo...

item.title: Takeaways From the NYC Mayoral Election and Zohran Mamdani’s Stunning Win
item.description: Zohran Mamdani motivated voters to head for the polls, using a broad coalition of supporters to overcome Andrew Cuomo’s success in siphoning Republica...

item.title: 6 Takeaways From Elections in Virginia, New Jersey, New York and Beyond
item.description: In Virginia, New Jersey and beyond, Democratic voters powered their candidates to victory and sent a warning sign to President Trump and his Republica...

item.title: What We Know About the UPS Plane Crash in Louisville
item.description: At least nine people died when a cargo plane crashed after takeoff in Louisville, Ky. The airport in reopened Wednesday morning, but officials warned ...

item.title: Palantir says college is no longer a reliable training ground—so it hired 22 high school students instead: ‘Skip the debt. Skip the indoctrination.’
item.description: 22 Gen Zers are currently graduating from Palantir’s Meritocracy Fellowship, as CEO Alex Karp calls his company "the best credential in tech."

item.title: OpenAI’s new safety tools are designed to make AI models harder to jailbreak. Instead, they may give users a false sense of security.
item.description: OpenAI has open-sourced two AI safety classifiers that let enterprises more easily set their own guardrails. Experts say the move could improve transp...

item.title: Abigail Spanberger Flips Virginia, Becomes State’s First Female Governor
item.description: In her campaign, Abigail Spanberger focused on jobs and the cost of living and emphasized her support for abortion rights.

item.title: Fire at Retirement Home in Bosnia Kills at Least 11
item.description: The country’s prime minister called the blaze “a disaster of enormous proportions.” The cause was still to be determined.

item.title: Elizabeth Tsurkov Recounts 2 1/2 Years of Captivity
item.description: Elizabeth Tsurkov, a citizen of Israel and Russia, recounts a harrowing story of cruelty, survival, U.S. diplomatic pressure and, finally, release fro...

item.title: Irish Police Got a Call About a Lion. It Was Actually a Dog Named Mouse.
item.description: A truck driver’s grainy video spurred bewilderment and speculation about a lion roaming in Ireland. Turns out it was a dog with an aggressive haircut.

item.title: Attacked by Swarm of Wasps, American Father and Son Die in Laos
item.description: Daniel Owen, 47, and his son, Cooper, 15, died after being stung dozens of times last month by what appeared to be so-called murder hornets.

item.title: Fire in Bosnia Rips Through Retirement Home
item.description: A blaze at a retirement home in a Bosnian city killed at least 11 people, mostly residents, according to the authorities. The cause of the fire remain...
